item.title: Ric's Webclient Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @alex809 alex809
item.description:
@alex809 wrote:

miller4:

I have a question, I am trying to add my webclient to my forums via Html, I am using (SD33) Pages on Ip.Board 3.3.3 and I need to figure out a way to make the client load, the HTML code lets it load but I don’t have a way to upload the actual client to get on… I can make a whole different page like this tutorial but I was wondering if someone could help me just add it right to my forums? Ive seen it a lot of times before.

Simple, Lucky for you i have also used Ip.board before (both nulled, unlicensed and i have also used a license i found online for 2 different versions at times.) Now do the same steps for your HTML web page. Just upload the client to your website that you have your ip.board on.

upload all the files to a directory in your webhosting. So create a directory named something (whatever you want) so if i named mine “rsps” then i would have to add the cache.zip to that folder and all the files to that folder. Once done you edit your files for your rsps to where the cache.zip is located for downloading. So it would be something like “http://yoursite.tld/rsps/cache.zip” and thats what downloads and extracts to there hard drive.

Now it should just load the way it should but it has to look for all the files in the same directory (not hard when it searches directories within its directory). That should work. And if you cant upload your files there then open a new account elsewhere on another host upload the files there make a fake website there to make it look legit and use that domain as the downloads section for your rsps.

It should work just fine. But if you do it and host the files remotely then the rsps has to be able to find the files remotely in order to run so its just easier to have them on your currently existing file server.

Read full topic

Ric, a few years back I tried this, couldn’t get it. Still can’t get it, getting the “Unexpected Error - Retrying in 5” thing.

Does anyone know a fix, and also I did not understand this

Once you have jarred and signed the client, Put the cache files(Everything inside the cache folder) and sprite "folder" in a zip file.

item.title: Ric's Webclient Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

[quote=“xI c E, post:930, topic:254656”][quote author=Mod Whip link=topic=336494.msg3925202#msg3925202 date=1330142968]
Got it working =) Good tutorial, for the most part this was fairly accurate to my client- just a few methods I had to rename and work around, all the imports were already in my client. Are there any free solutions on how to host the webclient for the public?
[/quote]

You can use a free webhost (000webhost.com is one that will work I believe) or host it via Apache from your own network.[/quote]
I tried setting up through this site. The jarred client works perfectly, and it works fine when I run double click the html file I made. However, it doesn’t work when it’s on this site (No response from loginserver error). What did I do wrong?

EDIT: Just set up apache and it works- how do I get the 000webhost to work?

Read full topic

item.title: Ric's Webclient Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @xI_c_E xI c E
item.description:
@xI_c_E wrote:

Mod Whip:

Got it working =) Good tutorial, for the most part this was fairly accurate to my client- just a few methods I had to rename and work around, all the imports were already in my client. Are there any free solutions on how to host the webclient for the public?

You can use a free webhost (000webhost.com is one that will work I believe) or host it via Apache from your own network.
